text: She won her lawsuit against a stalker and hotel with a spectacular $ 55 million judgment. But how much of that money will she actually take home? Sportscaster Erin Andrews has triumphed in a Nashville courtroom and then ignited social media by winning a $ 55 million judgment against the stalker who filmed her nude and the hotel where the incident occurred, but her spectacular seeming victory will certainly turn into a far smaller payout. Her stalker, Michael Barrett, is on the hook for $ 28 million of that judgment, but Andrews will never see that money. “ They can garnish his wages, but there ’ s essentially nothing to collect, ” says Rick Sanders, a litigator based in Nashville and a partner at Aaron & Sanders. “ He ’ s a perfect example of a judgment - proof defendant. ” That leaves the Nashville
